quest.name: Their Greatest Contribution
journal: Emet-Selch appears to be deep in thought.

On account of his conversance with the celestial, Emet-Selch believes that Hermes would be a welcome addition to the Convocation─assuming he is inclined to join. For now, you settle in for more observation as the chief overseer of Elpis goes about his work.

Having inspected the ampelos to his satisfaction, Hermes will next look in on a creature that is reportedly having problems─the charybdis. To that end, you make your way to the northern edge of Philomythes Notos.

You learn that a third-generation charybdis is unable to fly due to its aetheric balance leaning strongly towards water. Though the observer in charge wishes to revert the specimen and its kind, having deemed them a lost cause, Hermes is loath to give up on them, and offers to transform in order to guide the creature skyward. The proposal is met with shock and dismay, for transforming in public is considered vainglorious and unseemly. While Hermes seems willing to bear the shame if it means saving the creatures, Emet-Selch is not wholly convinced. It is then that Hythlodaeus conceives of a solution. For this, he sends Emet-Selch off with the charybdis, while you and the others remain to assist him with the necessary preparations.

Wearing a conspiratorial grin, Hythlodaeus reveals to you his grand plan: having Emet-Selch assist the charybdis. For your part, you are tasked with going to the man and making the initial plea. With the chat mode in Say, say “I have a favor to ask” to indicate to Emet-Selch that you have a request.
As you had been warned, Emet-Selch is disinclined to cooperate, but persistence is the key. With the chat mode in Say, say “Please, Emet-Selch” to batter the man's bulwark of petulant defiance.

Beneath the combined weight of your incessant nagging, Emet-Selch finally caves and agrees to assist the charybdis. As he tends to the creature, you enjoy a quiet conversation with Hythlodaeus, who speaks of Emet-Selch and their mutual friend with great fondness and admiration. The tale draws to a close just as the charybdis appears to find its wings, and Hythlodaeus bids you signal to Emet-Selch that he may return to the ground. A simple /wave should do the trick.

While the observer is impressed that the charybdis can in fact fly, he remains of the opinion that it would be better to simply have their concept adjusted. Hermes, however, is adamant that they continue to be given a chance to prove themselves a worthy addition to the star, and his underling acquiesces before taking his leave. With that, Hermes declares all his present tasks complete, and you set off together back to Anagnorisis.

In observing Hermes performing his duties, you have gained some insight into the workings of Elpis, but thus far have uncovered no clear connection to the Final Days. For the sake of the star and all you hold dear, you must keep searching for clues.
objectives: With the chat mode in Say, enter “I have a favor to ask” to Emet-Selch.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “Please, Emet-Selch” to Emet-Selch.
/wave to Emet-Selch from the edge of the isle.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Never before had I heard of dynamis or entelechies. I can only assume the Elpis flower was submitted to the bureau before I joined.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Entelechy or no, we're friends! In thinness!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: All appears to be well. This shouldn't take long.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Not that I or anyone else would be able to make use of it even if we knew...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: But it irks me to discover that there is an entirely different form of energy─and no one told me.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: That personal annoyance aside, Hermes's knowledge is undeniably impressive. Given that there are none among the Fourteen who specialize in the celestial, he would be a welcome addition.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Assuming he can be persuaded to join, that is. I still can't understand his hesitation...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Why did you join the Convocation?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What do you specialize in?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Oho, you wish to know why Emet-Selch was chosen for the Convocation? I should be glad to share the tale!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Ahem. It began when...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Not. Another. Word.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Lest you've forgotten, we're to learn about Hermes. Not me. My misspent youth is not your concern.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: (I'll tell you the tale when we're away from sensitive ears.)

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: <sigh> What now?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I want to learn about the Convocation.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Actually...never mind.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Hmmm... If you would accompany us, I suppose you should at least know that much.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The Convocation of Fourteen is a governing body that determines myriad policies. Our goal is to ensure that all is right in creation, that our star may know a brighter future.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: As the name suggests, the council is comprised of fourteen offices, each of which is held by an individual chosen for their surpassing abilities.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Depending on the office, one is required to either be an authority in a certain field, or possess skills that would facilitate the performance of their stipulated duties.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The former category includes Mitron, specialist in aquatic life; Loghrif, specialist in terrestrial life and husbandry...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Halmarut, specialist in fungal and plant life; Emmerololth, specialist in medicine and healing...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: And Lahabrea, specialist in creation magicks, who has brought forth phantom beings of the highest complexity.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: As for the latter category, there is Altima, advocate of the arts; Igeyorhm, champion of enlightenment and rhetoric; Pashtarot, preserver of discipline and order...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch, keeper of the aetherial realm─or “Underworld” in the vernacular; Fandaniel, pursuer of extant phenomena...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: And Azem, traveler of the world and counselor to the people.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: ...What? Should I be revealing such details to you? Don't be silly. Even children know this much, and you would do well to remember it all.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Then why did you bother me!? <sigh> Honestly, I'm beginning to think you were created for the sole purpose of trying my patience...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: My apologies for the wait. I have inspected the ampelos to my satisfaction.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: All is well with the creature, and I daresay it won't be long ere it is released unto the world.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Another creation, however, reportedly isn't faring so well─the charybdis.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: That is what we shall tend to next.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: If you would follow me, my friends, we shall return to the main isle and head north.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: A serpentine bird...or a winged snake?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: There is a slight difference in aetheric balance between these charybdises.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: By this, it may be assumed that they aren't the original creations, but their offspring.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Why is this one blue and shiny...?

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: Uwaaah! ...Oh, forgive me, I thought another member of the Convocation had come. This is turning out to be an eventful day...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: I understand there is a problem with one of the charybdis.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: Yes, that's right.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: As you know, the charybdis is based on a sea creature. Owing to adjustments to enhance its affinity to wind, it is capable of flight.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: The specimens created from the concept could all fly without issue, but a problem arose in subsequent generations.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: This third-generation creature was born with an aetheric balance leaning strongly towards water. Its aquatic origin reasserting itself, it would seem...

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: The result being its affinity to wind is diminished, and it cannot fly. No matter what we try, we can't get it to rise even the slightest bit.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: For such change to manifest in so few generations... I fear they are too unstable. Flawed.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: With your permission, I will revert the creatures, and recommend to the bureau that the concept be revised.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: ...With its aetheric balance leaning towards water, the charybdis would indeed struggle to manipulate wind.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Yet it is too early to conclude that it cannot fly. Having failed at first, it may simply have developed a fear.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: I shall transform and fly with it, helping it to manipulate wind until it finds its wings.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: What!? Y-You needn't go to such lengths...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: You don't know? <sigh> But of course not...

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Transformation is an art in which one manipulates a vast quantity of aether to construct another body around oneself.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: In practice, this allows one to assume any conceivable form, and thereby transcend the limits of one's flesh.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Yet convenient though it may be, transforming in the presence of others is considered vainglorious in the extreme. As uncouth and unseemly as running about robeless. Shameful.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Am I to understand you make a habit of this?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: N-Nothing of the sort. It's just that, when transformed, I can wield the wind and fly.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: It may seem excessive, but what is our shame next to the lives of these creatures?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: They deserve a chance, and we owe it to them to do all in our power!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Be that as it may...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Yes, I believe I have a solution. Emet-Selch─may I trouble you to move that charybdis away from its fellows? Somewhere out of sight.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I'd like the rest of you to help me prepare here.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: What mischief are you scheming now?

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: No mischief, I assure you. I would but spare you the need to report to your colleagues that Hermes committed an indiscretion.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: So have a little faith, and run along.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I trust you don't mind?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Well? Are your preparations for the scheme that is clearly not a scheme complete?

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Hythlodaeus is a man of ideas. I wonder what he has thought up this time...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: We must help the charybdis to fly. Or else they will all die!

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: Such bother when we could simply begin anew... But I shall defer to the chief overseer.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Emet-Selch is out of sight? Good. Let's speak of the plan.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: It's a stroke of genius, really: we have Emet-Selch train the charybdis!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Aside from being able to fly untransformed, he can readily see aether currents.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: And with his adept spellcraft, he can also employ suitable wind magicks to guide the creature along.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: While he is indeed capable of all you described, it is not his duty. I am loath to trouble him with it.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Don't be! As I mentioned, it would also be for his own sake. With that settled, let's begin at once!

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Forename─I want you to go to Emet-Selch. Tell him that you have a favor to ask.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: He will be disinclined to cooperate at first, but you mustn't be discouraged. With our friend, the trick is to be unflaggingly persistent.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: Off you go, now, and good luck!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the words “I have a favor to ask” to indicate to Emet-Selch that you have a request.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: The rest of us will be right behind you. We wouldn't think to miss the fun!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: With apologies to Emet-Selch, but this may be the best approach. Let us work together to win him over!

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: I'll persist too!

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: M-Me...? Uh...perhaps it's best if I watched from afar...

dialogue.name: SAYTODO
dialogue.text: I have a favor to ask

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Well? Are your preparations for the scheme that is clearly not a scheme complete?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the words “I have a favor to ask” to indicate to Emet-Selch that you have a request.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Oh no you don't! I'm not lifting a finger!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Ugh. I don't know what Hythlodaeus is up to, and I will not be made to know. I refuse!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If Hythlodaeus is to be believed, relentless insistence may serve to wear down the ever-weary Emet-Selch...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the words “Please, Emet-Selch” to plead with Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: SAYTODO
dialogue.text: Please, Emet-Selch

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: You may tell Hythlodaeus he can contrive another brilliant solution─one that doesn't involve me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase containing the words “Please, Emet-Selch” to plead with Emet-Selch.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: If I didn't know better, I'd say Emet-Selch is enjoying himself. Not that he'd ever deign to admit it.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: It's flying... It's really flying, as if it were born to do so... Thank goodness...

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Look, Forename! Look how well the charybdis flies!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The charybdis appears to be the subject of Emet-Selch's undivided attention. You may need to wave rather forcefully in his general direction to remind him that you and the others exist.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Emerging from his reverie, Emet-Selch notices you, and begins to descend with the charybdis...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: I have no words to express my gratitude. Thanks to you, the charybdis has learned to fly.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: And Forename and I could relax and have a pleasant chat.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: I'm sure you did.

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: The creature needed some small assistance at first, but soon it was flying more or less on its own. I doubt you will need to repeat the lesson.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: That was truly impressive!

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: I witnessed it all from afar─the charybdis flies!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Indeed. With this, we've proven that even a creature with skewed aetheric balance is capable of flight.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Though we helped it to achieve this, the charybdis is a herd animal. They may well aid their struggling kin in like fashion if and when the need arises.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Keeping this in mind, I bid you continue observing them.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: If that is what you want...

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: But if I may say so, rather than hoping an idealistic possibility comes to pass, would it not be simpler to have the concept adjusted? That way, we could guarantee that anomalies such as this specimen are never born in the first place.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: These creatures are already here. We will spare no effort in giving them a chance to survive.

dialogue.name: ANAGNORISISSTAFF04425
dialogue.text: As you wish, Chief. As you wish.

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: Hermes...

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: I'm fine. Don't worry.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Well, that concludes all of my present tasks.

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Let us return to Anagnorisis for now.

dialogue.name: HYTHLODAEUS
dialogue.text: I thoroughly enjoyed myself─at the end most of all!

dialogue.name: HERMES
dialogue.text: Now you've seen what I do. Was it everything you were expecting...?

dialogue.name: METEION
dialogue.text: All the creations are happy. That makes me happy too!

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: ...What? Want to apologize for forcing me to help, do you?

dialogue.name: EMETSELCH
dialogue.text: Save your breath. You didn't force me to do anything─I merely chose the most expeditious way to have done with an impediment to our business.
